result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CM94 AND 15CM97

10:03  State relates and gives appearances.  This 
Agreement had been for the forfeiture of the  $1000 cash bond that covered both above cases.  State moves for order of forfeiture of cash posted to go to Barron County General Fund.  Court grants.

Clerked by CS
Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF229, 15CM94, 15CM97, 15CM136 AND 15TR162. 
15CF229 - Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. 
Counts 2, 3 and 4 - DRI. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement.

Court orders: 
Total sentence of 5 years, 0 months in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 yrs 0 months initial confinement and 3 yrs 0 months extended supervision - consecutive to 15CT18 - STAYED
3 yrs Probation - IMPOSED
$600.00 fine plus costs.
6 months jail with work release - consecutive to 15CT18
36 month revocation of DL
IID for 36 months
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
DNA sample and surcharge.

Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Is eligible for substance abuse program

15CM94  & 15CM97 - DRI. $1,000.00 cash bond to be forfeited to the Barron County General Fund. Bail/Bond forfeiture hearing to be scheduled.

15CM136 - Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Count 2 - DRI. Court orders Court costs. 

15TR162 - State moves to dismiss. Court dismisses.

Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CM97, 15CF229, 15CM136, 15CM39 AND 15CM94.
15CM39: State moves to dismiss. Court grants dismissal. 15TR162 that was tracking with 15CM39 is not dismissed and will now track with 15CF229. 
15CF229: Initial held. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information. Defendant waives formal reading of Information and elects to stand mute. Court enters NG pleas on Defendant's behalf. 

Plea hearing on all remaining open files set for 6/16/15 at 3:00 p.m. for one hour.

clerked by RWinger
Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM136, 15CM97,15CM94, 15CM39, 15TR162, 15CT18, and 14CT255. 

15CM136 : Qualifies for PD. Formal reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Court amends count 2 of the Complaint to indicate offense date of April 18. Bond set.
Plea questionnaire filed. 

14CT255:  State moves to dismiss and read in. Court grants. 

15CT18:
Defendant pleads guilty to Guilty to Count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
State moves to dismiss and read in Counts 2 and 3. Court grants. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court. 

Court relates and orders: 
.251 BAC 
$1694.00 fine inclusive of costs. 
110 days jail with good time. 7 days jail credit. 
30 month DL revocation
30 month IID 
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

15CM97,15CM94, 15CM39 and 15TR162 to track with 15CM136 to be held before Judge Boyle. 

ALL WARRANTS QUASHED.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney John Gerard Hinde in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CT255, 15CM94, 15CM97, 15CT18,15CM39.
State requests warrant - body only - statewide.  Court grants.

Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CM94, 15CM97, 14CT255, 15CM39, 15CT18, 15TR162.
Reset.  Bond continues.
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

THIS BOND COVERS 15CM94 AND 15CM97

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.

May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Submit to daily PBTs at Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 PM.

Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney Angela Lynn Beranek.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant pleads NG to all above cases.
Plea hearing set to cover both above cases.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
